result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquise M Smith in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson for Arial Rosenberg in court for Marquise M Smith.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion hearing.  Attorney Rosenberg unable to appear today.  Discussion held regarding Motion to Suppress.  Court sets further deadline of 11/28/2022 for Defense to file supplemental brief and any supporting documentation.  Court will issue an Oral Ruling on the next date. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Decision scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-27-2022, filed.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 8/31/2022  (66 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.
Pretrial Services Status Report - 09-30-2022, filed.
/filed.

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Marquise M Smith.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for motion hearing.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer Jason Daering; City of Milwaukee Police Officer Nicholas Schlei.  Exhibit 1 received.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Arguments heard.  Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to testify. Defense requests additional time to investigate issue relating to body cam glitch.  Objection by the State.  For the reasons stated on the record, the court find good cause to adjourn this matter for further Evidentiary Hearing on Motion to Suppress.  Case adjourned in Branch 9
Motion hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-30-2022, filed.
State's Response Brief, filed.
State's Motion for Modification of Briefing Schedule, filed

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has filed a motion to suppress evidence and is requesting an evidentiary hearing. Court sets deadline for the State to file a response for 08/15/2022.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse. Case is adjourned.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed. Defense Motion to Suppress Based on Unlawful Stop and Seizure
Received and Filed. Motion to Extend Cell Phone Extraction Discovery

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Due to reasons stated on the record, the Court denied the State's motion to extend phone extraction deadline filed on 5/31/2022. Court set new filing deadlines with parties. Defense has until June 13th, 2022, to file any motions. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 05-27-2022
Received and Filed. DEFENSES REQUEST AND ORDER GRANTING ADDITIONAL TIME TO FILE PRETRIAL MOTIONS

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Court sets a deadline of 5/6/22 for the exchange of discovery with the exception of crime lab reports. Parties to file motions and/or plea paperwork by 5/27/22. Case is adjourned to Br. 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 03-22-2022, filed.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (14 pages) commencing   02-21-22 by  EMILY REBEK

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Daering. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Preliminary hearing on February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 3 Supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquise M Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
